case_vignette: A 67-year-old male presents to your office one day after an injury. Yesterday he tried to play basketball with his grandchildren and he was doing well until he jumped to get the ball and landed awkwardly on his right foot, after which he could not bear weight on his foot. On exam, his right foot is significant for swelling with tenderness to palpation anterior to the Achilles tendon. The patient has no tenderness over his medial or lateral malleoli. Figure A is a radiograph of his right foot with the area of traumatic injury.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I injured my right foot playing basketball with my grandchildren, and now it's swollen and hurts when touched near the back part above the heel, and I can't put weight on it to walk.
How old are you?
I am 67 years old.
Do you have any other medical conditions or take any medications?
The information you're asking for hasn't been provided to me.
Understood. Do you have a history of any bone or joint issues?
That hasn't been given to me either.
I see. Is there a history of osteoporosis or arthritis in your family?
I don't have that information.
Understood. Have you experienced any similar symptoms in the past?
No, I haven't.
**Final Diagnosis:** Achilles Tendon Rupture
